Language.Text:
You enter the headquarters and see a couple of militia controllers staffing consoles. A young woman with captain's bars turns as you enter. She sizes you up for a long second, trying to decide whether you're help or trouble.
"I saw your ship come in. It's nice. You seen a lot of action?"

"And you're looking for more? Maybe you're addicted to the thrills. Alone, in control, ready to deal out justice one missile at a time. No family. No attachments. Just the high-G turns and the buzz of escaping death again.
"Sound familiar?"

She stares at you for a while without a smile, then nods and shoots out her hand.
"I'm Captain Pereira, and I manage volunteers for the militia. There's work for you if you want it."

Captain Pereira greets you as you enter.
"Welcome back, %name%. Ready for another mission?"

Captain Pereira greets you as you enter.
"Welcome back, %name%. I'm surprised you're back. I expected you to be moving on to the next system. You're not getting attached, are you?"

The captain smiles and shakes her head.
"I'm jealous. I've got another year of duty here, but then I'm putting in for transfer to the Fleet. I want to be out there, beyond the edge. I'd love to see the nebulas of Point Juno, or the scorching light of Jiang's Star."

"I know. I'm patient, and things aren't so bad here. Much more exciting than my Earth-bound life growing up.
"Speaking of which, I've got a mission for you."

Captain Pereira greets you as you enter.
"Welcome back, %name%. I've got another mission for you."
